commit_message:
trivial: Remove unused function parameter

The 'never_serialize_result' parameter of the
'get_host_numa_usage_from_instance' function has no callers that aren't
tests. Remove it.

Change-Id: Iff9730d19486122cd5ce174b0129546edf2a3224
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for DPDK to opensuse openvswitch image

This patch adds a leap 15.0 openvswitch image with DPDK support by
installing both ovs and dpdk available packages. The versions are:

openvswitch 2.11
dpdk 18.11.0

Change-Id: Idc1973f5ea3dd3be2e4cf1c964cf0e60c849a159
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

Test using integrated build

In order to do a more complete verification of any patches,
we add a full uncontainerised OpenStack deployment to the
functional testing using the integrated repo.

commit_message:
Fix missing syslog name in libvirt log setting

The commit I6e5ac7f5971df5998db22c5d392084fddf77d34a  makes libvirt
directly send logs to rsyslog to avoid duplicated header, but in fact
it was not working properly because of missing syslog name specified.

This patch fixes the wrong value passed there, so that we have
the log surely directed to syslog.

Change-Id: I246d0f365c1b8eef7730a1abe0507555e23e6408

commit_message:
SQUASH: Use ksa adapter for Nova communication

A start on using a keystoneauth1 Adapter instead of python-novaclient to
talk to the nova service for power-update events.

This is not complete: I didn't test anything.

Change-Id: Id8686bd6f9bd6555f92ae64542442c43a61e55e7

commit_message:
Close resources correctly

Under python3 not closing file handles or network resources correctly
results in warnings being shown to the end user. This change switches
the resource usage to properly close when we're done.

Change-Id: Iaf08f7d7b919b154797cf8f10663f349424cd6a2
Related-Bug: #1837393

commit_message:
RabbitMQ: Dont remove definitions.json and erlang cookie when resetting

This PS udpated the reset node function to leave the assets generated
via init containers in place when resetting the node.

Change-Id: Iac52ca82e95bb372dbcbca0eeea3b262215e9c12
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-31 15:45:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AttributeError in RT._update_usage_from_migration

Change Ieb539c9a0cfbac743c579a1633234537a8e3e3ee in Stein
added some logging in _update_usage_from_migration to log
the flavor for an inbound and outbound migration.

If an instance is resized and then the resize is immediately
confirmed, it's possible to race with ComputeManager._confirm_resize
setting the instance.old_flavor to None before the migration
status is changed to "confirmed" while the update_available_resource
periodic is running which will result in _update_usage_from_migration
hitting an AttributeError when trying to log instance.old_flavor.flavorid
since instance.old_flavor is None.

There are a few key points there:

- We get into _update_usage_from_migration because the
  _update_available_resource method gets in-progress migrations
  related to the host (in this case the source compute) and the
  migration is consider in-progress until its status is "confirmed".

- The instance is not in the tracked_instances dict when
  _update_usage_from_migration runs because RT only tracks instances
  where the instance.host matches the RT.host and in this case the
  instance has been resized to another compute and the instance.host
  is pointing at the dest compute.

The fix here is to simply check if we got the instance.old_flavor and
not log the message if we do not have it, which gets us back to the old
behavior.

This bug was found by noticing it in CI job logs - there is a link to
hits in logstash in the bug report.

As for the "incoming and not tracked" case in _update_usage_from_migration
I have not modified that since I am not sure we have the same race nor
have I seen it in CI logs.

Change-Id: I43e34b3ff1424d42632a3e8f842c93508905aa1a
Closes-Bug: #1834349
(cherry picked from commit 818419c9d313bd6151d1a05b3a087a15116f61b8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in RT._update_usage_from_migration

Change Ieb539c9a0cfbac743c579a1633234537a8e3e3ee in Stein
added some logging in _update_usage_from_migration to log
the flavor for an inbound and outbound migration.

If an instance is resized and then the resize is immediately
confirmed, it's possible to race with ComputeManager._confirm_resize
setting the instance.old_flavor to None before the migration
status is changed to "confirmed" while the update_available_resource
periodic is running which will result in _update_usage_from_migration
hitting an AttributeError when trying to log instance.old_flavor.flavorid
since instance.old_flavor is None.

There are a few key points there:

- We get into _update_usage_from_migration because the
  _update_available_resource method gets in-progress migrations
  related to the host (in this case the source compute) and the
  migration is consider in-progress until its status is "confirmed".

- The instance is not in the tracked_instances dict when
  _update_usage_from_migration runs because RT only tracks instances
  where the instance.host matches the RT.host and in this case the
  instance has been resized to another compute and the instance.host
  is pointing at the dest compute.

The fix here is to simply check if we got the instance.old_flavor and
not log the message if we do not have it, which gets us back to the old
behavior.

This bug was found by noticing it in CI job logs - there is a link to
hits in logstash in the bug report.

As for the "incoming and not tracked" case in _update_usage_from_migration
I have not modified that since I am not sure we have the same race nor
have I seen it in CI logs.

Change-Id: I43e34b3ff1424d42632a3e8f842c93508905aa1a
Closes-Bug: #1834349
(cherry picked from commit 818419c9d313bd6151d1a05b3a087a15116f61b8)

commit_message:
[476959] Change the nagios state information policy

Nagios uses the “state_retention_file” configuration parameter by default.
(ie, retain the state information for hosts and services between the restarts)

But for the kubernetes controlled deployments, we can disable this.
Currently it is using big chunk of storage space(>26G)

Change-Id: I695beb9463c3ef590dd16888dfe712b24a308856

commit_message:
check the task state after creating image

The operation is not really done while the status of image is ACTIVE, nova
would update the properties of new image and do some operation on server,
so it is better to check the task state.

[{'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-23 19:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-23 19:26:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-23 19:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-23 19:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30683, 'date': '2019-07-23 20:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28701, 'date': '2019-07-23 20:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30746, 'date': '2019-07-23 20:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Just a small nitpick but otherwise looks good.'}, {'account_id': 30690, 'date': '2019-07-23 20:23:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-23 20:41:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-23 20:54:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28701, 'date': '2019-07-23 20:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30746, 'date': '2019-07-23 20:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-07-23 23:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Under what circumstances would no resource types even be present? https://docs.openstack.org/heat/rocky/template_guide/openstack.html returns a pretty expansive list.

Also looking at the bug report, it looks like glance isn't returning any resource types -- instead of "resource type associations". Resource type associations can be created.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-07-24 00:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the work, and just soft -1 to make clear one thing:
If an environment has no glance resource_types, is it a bug of the deployment tool? Or is it a normal use case?'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-07-24 18:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Under what circumstances would no resource types even be present?
 > https://docs.openstack.org/heat/rocky/template_guide/openstack.html
 > returns a pretty expansive list.
 > 
 > Also looking at the bug report, it looks like glance isn't
 > returning any resource types -- instead of "resource type
 > associations". Resource type associations can be created.

Our environment is for VNF and we do not have any glance metadata resource types defined at this time. https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html
That may change but at this time we are trying to run the full tempest test suite against our deployments and trying to add more intelligence to that suite so test will enable when feature or data change in our environment. 
Thank you for the reviewing and I hope all is well.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-24 19:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

> Thanks for the work, and just soft -1 to make clear one thing:
 > If an environment has no glance resource_types, is it a bug of the
 > deployment tool? Or is it a normal use case?

 > Thanks for the work, and just soft -1 to make clear one thing:
 > If an environment has no glance resource_types, is it a bug of the
 > deployment tool? Or is it a normal use case?

We have talked to our design engineers and at this time that is the normal use case'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-24 21:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-07-25 04:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

One more space on your if statement contents. Let talk in the morning if you have any questions.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-25 13:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-25 13:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-25 14:19:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-25 14:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-25 14:24:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-07-25 14:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> One more space on your if statement contents. Let talk in the
 > morning if you have any questions.

 > One more space on your if statement contents. Let talk in the
 > morning if you have any questions.

 > One more space on your if statement contents. Let talk in the
 > morning if you have any questions.

Yes, fixed it'}, {'account_id': 30683, 'date': '2019-07-25 20:21:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-07-26 01:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

This was one of common requirements of Tempest, but we have a consensus Tempest should not have automatic skip mechanism which depends on API call like this.

There are a lot of tests in Tempest and it is difficult to detect some tests are skipped unexpectedly if implementing automatic skip.
So we need to add corresponding config option as https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/REVIEWING.rst#being-explicit'}, {'account_id': 30683, 'date': '2019-07-26 18:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

We can create the necessary config option and perform a testtools.skipIf or skip_checks condition such as the immutable checks in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672993/.'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-08-02 12:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

I work with Soumya and after reviewing the comments we have decided not to continue with this direction since auto-skipping could cause upstream CI to hide a bug and a conf value for just one test case does not make sense since we can just blacklist it in downstream CI.  We will keep this more in mind when looking into changes for support upstream and downstream CI.  Since we do not own the bug we will not effect the status of the bug but we will abandon this commit.'}, {'account_id': 30666, 'date': '2019-08-02 14:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning as blacklisted in downstream CI'}]

commit_message:
Fix Glance test by adding a skipcheck

If glance does not have any resource type association，it will experience an
IndexError when getting resource_name from list_resource_types
response body because the response body does not have any resource_types.

This patch fixes this bug with the following method:
Adding a skipcheck if the deployment does not have image metadata

Closes-Bug: #1807559
Change-Id: I82fcc93e9c3effebd9158ca2fbf75f6b41740dfd

[{'created': '2019-06-19 13:51:26.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using veth pairs to connect qdhcp ns

veth pairs are currently being used to connect the qdhcp namespace
to the underlying bridge. This behaviour appears to only be needed
for old kernels with limited namespaces support (pre trusty).

Change-Id: If1f669de09e2499e74e88e2b72203047e7f9f957
Closes-Bug: #1832021
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using veth pairs to connect qdhcp ns

veth pairs are currently being used to connect the qdhcp namespace
to the underlying bridge. This behaviour appears to only be needed
for old kernels with limited namespaces support (pre trusty).

Change-Id: If1f669de09e2499e74e88e2b72203047e7f9f957
Closes-Bug: #1832021

commit_message:
Add distribution of metrics.yml

As cloudkitty requires metrics.yml to be present in etc directory
to be fully operational, we're distributing this file by default[1]
cloudkitty_metrics_overrides variable added in order to override default

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/30/673530/2/check/openstack-ansible-functional-ubuntu-bionic/c6eee8a/logs/openstack/openstack1/cloudkitty-processor.service.journal.log.txt.gz#_Jul_30_14_44_00

Change-Id: Ie08cfd0d8dc4835712df0b937170b631aebd10c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 19:08:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add Migration.cross_cell_move and get_by_uuid

This adds a new boolean column, cross_cell_move,
to the migrations table in the cell database and
corresponding field in the Migrations versioned
object. This will be used to track cross-cell
resize operations. Also, a Migration.get_by_uuid()
method is added to the versioned object because
while doing a cross-cell resize, we will need to
be able to lookup a migration record via its uuid
which will be unique across cell databases, unlike
its id value which is specific to each cell database.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I63411214c412af93501b27eb39f97bf980b21760

Change-Id: I63411214c412af93501b27eb39f97bf980b21760
'}, {'created': '2018-11-30 17:09:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add Migration.cross_cell_move and get_by_uuid

This adds a new boolean column, cross_cell_move,
to the migrations table in the cell database and
corresponding field in the Migrations versioned
object. This will be used to track cross-cell
resize operations. Also, a Migration.get_by_uuid()
method is added to the versioned object because
while doing a cross-cell resize, we will need to
be able to lookup a migration record via its uuid
which will be unique across cell databases, unlike
its id value which is specific to each cell database.

Note that we opt to not store the source/dest cell
UUIDs directly in the migrations table because the
migrations records are stored in the cell database and
we prefer to keep the cell information (which is in the
API) separated from the cell database, especially in
case the cell UUID maps to something that does not
exist later (like if the cell is split).

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I63411214c412af93501b27eb39f97bf980b21760

case the cell UUID maps to something that does not
exist later (like if the cell is split).

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

'}, {'created': '2019-02-26 22:16:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add Migration.cross_cell_move and get_by_uuid

This adds a new boolean column, cross_cell_move,
to the migrations table in the cell database and
corresponding field in the Migrations versioned
object. This will be used to track cross-cell
resize operations. Also, a Migration.get_by_uuid()
method is added to the versioned object because
while doing a cross-cell resize, we will need to
be able to lookup a migration record via its uuid
which will be unique across cell databases, unlike
its id value which is specific to each cell database.

Note that we opt to not store the source/dest cell
UUIDs directly in the migrations table because the
migrations records are stored in the cell database and
we prefer to keep the cell information (which is in the
API) separated from the cell database, especially in
case the cell UUID maps to something that does not
exist later (like if the cell is split).

commit_message:
Add Migration.cross_cell_move and get_by_uuid

This adds a new boolean column, cross_cell_move,
to the migrations table in the cell database and
corresponding field in the Migrations versioned
object. This will be used to track cross-cell
resize operations. Also, a Migration.get_by_uuid()
method is added to the versioned object because
while doing a cross-cell resize, we will need to
be able to lookup a migration record via its uuid
which will be unique across cell databases, unlike
its id value which is specific to each cell database.

Note that we opt to not store the source/dest cell
UUIDs directly in the migrations table because the
migrations records are stored in the cell database and
we prefer to keep the cell information (which is in the
API) separated from the cell database, especially in
case the cell UUID maps to something that does not
exist later (like if the cell is split).

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I63411214c412af93501b27eb39f97bf980b21760

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 13:11:15.000000000', 'message': "During deploy, always sync DB

A common class of problems goes like this:

* kolla-ansible deploy
* Hit a problem, often in ansible/roles/*/tasks/bootstrap.yml
* Re-run kolla-ansible deploy
* Service fails to start

This happens because the DB is created during the first run, but for some
reason we fail before performing the DB sync. This means that on the second run
we don't include ansible/roles/*/tasks/bootstrap_service.yml because the DB
already exists, and therefore still don't perform the DB sync. However this
time, the command may complete without apparent error.

We should be less careful about when we perform the DB sync, and do it whenever
it is necessary. There is an argument for not doing the sync during a
'reconfigure' command, although we will not change that here.

This change only always performs the DB sync during 'deploy' and
'reconfigure' commands.

Change-Id: I82d30f3fcf325a3fdff3c59f19a1f88055b566cc
Closes-Bug: #1823766
Closes-Bug: #1797814
(cherry picked from commit d5e5e885d11e338806425839a361d868c1f4ff10)
"}]
commit_message:
During deploy, always sync DB

A common class of problems goes like this:

* kolla-ansible deploy
* Hit a problem, often in ansible/roles/*/tasks/bootstrap.yml
* Re-run kolla-ansible deploy
* Service fails to start

This happens because the DB is created during the first run, but for some
reason we fail before performing the DB sync. This means that on the second run
we don't include ansible/roles/*/tasks/bootstrap_service.yml because the DB
already exists, and therefore still don't perform the DB sync. However this
time, the command may complete without apparent error.

We should be less careful about when we perform the DB sync, and do it whenever
it is necessary. There is an argument for not doing the sync during a
'reconfigure' command, although we will not change that here.

This change only always performs the DB sync during 'deploy' and
'reconfigure' commands.

Change-Id: I82d30f3fcf325a3fdff3c59f19a1f88055b566cc
Closes-Bug: #1823766
Closes-Bug: #1797814
(cherry picked from commit d5e5e885d11e338806425839a361d868c1f4ff10)

[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-22 22:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-07-23 11:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

The code looks correct for the desired change. I also wrote some follow-on probe tests to give further confidence and help document the behavior.

A couple of concerns: 
  1. we don't seem to have unit tests for the replication policy.
  2. From the number of unit tests changed, I am concerned that we had purposely documented (if not *designed) for the behavior to be a 404 response and now we are changing that. Sure the new argument seems correct (especially in the EC case where we know we have something there and we just can't reconstruct) but I keep asking why our old selves chose the behavior we chose. It seems we were more willing to rely on the eventual consistency behavior of the system. "If I can't get your data, then it must not be there (or at least I assume it is not there, but), eventually I'll get it".'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-07-23 11:43:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Just fyi, I'm also seeing the flaky unit test on my env. looking into that next."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-23 14:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-07-23 17:36:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(7 comments)

I'm surprise more tests didn't break!

My opinion is strongly leaning towards this is a solid change in a positive direction!

PTL would like additional input - please chime in!"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-23 17:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(4 comments)

thanks for calling attention where needed PTL!  :hugs:'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-24 20:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-24 20:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-25 00:41:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-25 01:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-07-25 12:26:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I think this patch gets us to the latest described in the etherpad[1]. reconstructing from non-durable fragments should be a follow-on patch. For now I've written a new probe test[2] to confirm the 404 behavior.

Added a test to demonstrate replicated behavior."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-08-01 22:22:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

WFM!

FWIW I prefer to add tests to controller/test_obj instead of the already _massive_ proxy/test_server when possible:

	diff --git a/test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py b/test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py
	index b98b6ad0f..cab78bcd7 100644
	--- a/test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py
	+++ b/test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py
	@@ -1570,6 +1570,14 @@ class TestReplicatedObjController(CommonObjectControllerMixin,
		     resp = req.get_response(self.app)
		 self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 404)
	 
	+    def test_GET_primaries_timeout_error(self):
	+        req = swift.common.swob.Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o')
	+        codes = ([Timeout()] * self.obj_ring.replicas) + (
	+            [404] * self.obj_ring.max_more_nodes)
	+        with set_http_connect(*codes):
	+            resp = req.get_response(self.app)
	+        self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 503)
	+
	     def test_GET_not_found_when_404_newer(self):
		 # if proxy receives a 404, it keeps waiting for other connections until
		 # max number of nodes in hopes of finding an object, but if 404 is

P.S. I'm always terrified that GreenAsyncPile hangs when I throw an exception in that _make_node_request block -> https://review.opendev.org/#/c/623360/"}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-08-02 11:44:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Let's land this and we can adjust tests on a follow-on patch..."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-22 22:21:20.000000000', 'message': "Ignore 404s from handoffs for objects when calculating quorum

We previously realized we needed to do that for accounts and containers
where the consequences of treating the 404 as authoritative were more
obvious: we'd cache the non-existence which prevented writes until it
fell out of cache.

The same basic logic applies for objects, though: if we see

    (Timeout, Timeout, Timeout, 404, 404, 404)

on a triple-replica policy, we don't really have any reason to think
that a 404 is appropriate. In fact, it seems reasonably likely that
there's a thundering-herd problem where there are too many concurrent
requests for data that *definitely is there*. By responding with a 503,
we apply some back-pressure to clients, who hopefully have some
exponential backoff in their retries.

The situation gets a bit more complicated with erasure-coded data, but
the same basic principle applies. We're just more likely to have
confirmation that there *is* data out there, we just can't reconstruct
it (right now).

Note that we *still want to check* those handoffs, of course. Our
fail-in-place strategy has us replicate (and, more recently,
reconstruct) to handoffs to maintain durability; it'd be silly *not* to
look.

Change-Id: Ia832e9bab13167948f01bc50aa8a61974ce189fb
Related-Bug: #1833612
Related-Change: I53ed04b5de20c261ddd79c98c629580472e09961
Related-Change: Ief44ed39d97f65e4270bf73051da9a2dd0ddbaec

UpgradeImpact:
--------------
This may cause an increase in 503 Service Unavailable responses served
by proxy-servers. This should more accurately reflect the state of the
system. However, if you need to return to the previous behavior where
such requests would have been served with a 404 Not Found response, you
can set

    consider_404s_from_object_handoffs = True

in your proxy-server.conf

Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiagodasilva@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ignore 404s from handoffs for objects when calculating quorum

We previously realized we needed to do that for accounts and containers
where the consequences of treating the 404 as authoritative were more
obvious: we'd cache the non-existence which prevented writes until it
fell out of cache.

The same basic logic applies for objects, though: if we see

    (Timeout, Timeout, Timeout, 404, 404, 404)

on a triple-replica policy, we don't really have any reason to think
that a 404 is appropriate. In fact, it seems reasonably likely that
there's a thundering-herd problem where there are too many concurrent
requests for data that *definitely is there*. By responding with a 503,
we apply some back-pressure to clients, who hopefully have some
exponential backoff in their retries.

The situation gets a bit more complicated with erasure-coded data, but
the same basic principle applies. We're just more likely to have
confirmation that there *is* data out there, we just can't reconstruct
it (right now).

Note that we *still want to check* those handoffs, of course. Our
fail-in-place strategy has us replicate (and, more recently,
reconstruct) to handoffs to maintain durability; it'd be silly *not* to
look.

UpgradeImpact:
--------------
Be aware that this may cause an increase in 503 Service Unavailable
responses served by proxy-servers. However, this should more accurately
reflect the state of the system.

Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiagodasilva@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia832e9bab13167948f01bc50aa8a61974ce189fb
Closes-Bug: #1837819
Related-Bug: #1833612
Related-Change: I53ed04b5de20c261ddd79c98c629580472e09961

commit_message:
sharding: better handle get_shard_ranges failures

The contract for ReplConnection.replicate() is that if we can get a
response, we return it, and if we can't (because of a timeout, or a
socket error, or some other http_client error like BadStatusLine), we
return None to indicate the error.

Previously, _fetch_and_merge_shard_ranges() always assumed the
response would have a `status` attribute and raise an AttributeError
when response was None. Now it will treat that case like other
get_shard_range failures.

Change-Id: I023b8a46c06e9a2755b5aa890a7992ef9633cba9

[{'created': '2019-07-31 16:21:25.000000000', 'message': 'Un-quote metadata address if it is IPv6

In lib/neutron-legacy, the Nova metadata host address is
un-quoted if it is IPv6, i.e. 2001:db8::1, not [2001:db8::1].
We should be doing the same in lib/neutron.

Change-Id: I80c96603a41ef9d289712ef15b464859aa9257be
'}]
commit_message:
Un-quote metadata address if it is IPv6

In lib/neutron-legacy, the Nova metadata host address is
un-quoted if it is IPv6, i.e. 2001:db8::1, not [2001:db8::1].
We should be doing the same in lib/neutron.

Change-Id: I80c96603a41ef9d289712ef15b464859aa9257be

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-01 19:58:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix default RPC worker count

The help for the rpc_workers config option is:

    Number of RPC worker processes for service.  If not specified, the
    default is equal to half the number of API workers.

However, this does not accurately describe the current behaviour,
which is to default to half the _default_ number of API workers.  This
can make a big difference; for example on a 256-CPU machine with 256GB
of RAM which has api_workers configured to 8 but rpc_workers not
configured to anything, this will result in 64 RPC workers, which is 8
for every API worker!

Therefore tweak the default to rely on the actual value of
api_workers, which may be different than the default value.

Change-Id: I26115932ef4775f157297be1637ee26a4fca4666
Related-Bug: #1838688
Closes-Bug: #1838689
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default RPC worker count

The help for the rpc_workers config option is:

    Number of RPC worker processes for service.  If not specified, the
    default is equal to half the number of API workers.

However, this does not accurately describe the current behaviour,
which is to default to half the _default_ number of API workers.  This
can make a big difference; for example on a 256-CPU machine with 256GB
of RAM which has api_workers configured to 8 but rpc_workers not
configured to anything, this will result in 64 RPC workers, which is 8
for every API worker!

Therefore tweak the default to rely on the actual value of
api_workers, which may be different than the default value.

Change-Id: I26115932ef4775f157297be1637ee26a4fca4666
Related-Bug: #1838688
Closes-Bug: #1838689

commit_message:
(Re-)enable vnc console tests in nova-multi-cell job

This reverts commit 47b73030cba7d67fe308c5b89c2a64e93d74bcd6.

The dependent devstack change fixes the issue so we can enable
vnc console tempest testing in the nova-multi-cell job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/661391/

Change-Id: Iad71b6e15bb91e51080cd9f940410dc9af791963
Related-Bug: #1830417

[{'created': '2019-07-02 10:05:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix DetachedInstanceError for VolumeAttachment

Patch I253123d5451b32f0e3143916e41aaa1af75561c2 fixed the
DetachedInstanceError for VolumeAttachment OVOs but only partially, as
apparently it was dependent on the SQLAlchemy version due to the use os
"hasattr".

This patch replaces "hasattr" with a check on the object's dictionary,
which will never trigger a Lazy Load.

Closes-Bug: #1834845
Change-Id: Iac785eef9be4b9cdb5c739ee0a87949805282867

commit_message:
Fix DetachedInstanceError for VolumeAttachment

Patch I253123d5451b32f0e3143916e41aaa1af75561c2 fixed the
DetachedInstanceError for VolumeAttachment OVOs but only partially, as
apparently it was dependent on the SQLAlchemy version due to the use os
"hasattr".

This patch replaces "hasattr" with a check on the object's dictionary,
which will never trigger a Lazy Load.

Closes-Bug: #1834845
Change-Id: Iac785eef9be4b9cdb5c739ee0a87949805282867

commit_message:
Fix wrong indentation in ansible-autodoc.py sphinx extension.

This patch fixes issue when trying to build documentation with sphinx
1.8.x and python 2.7.x but was passing smoothly with python 3 and sphinx
> 2.x.

Change-Id: Ia5b12fe05903a4c33132d9c862f0543cfdb11418
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix ansible-generate-inventory action

ansible-generate-inventory action raises Exception
when 'ansible_python_interpreter' input is passed to it.

This patch fixes it and also update unit test to cover
missing part.

[{'created': '2019-05-24 20:24:06.000000000', 'message': 'Configure console proxy ports in nova-cpu.conf

In change I8934d0b9392f2976347391c8a650ad260f337762, we began
configuring console proxy ports for multiple cells in the nova
controller config files to avoid "Address already in use" errors from
port collisions when running multiple cells on a single host.

This correspondingly configures the console proxy ports in the nova
compute config file based on what cell we're in, according to the
NOVA_CPU_CELL variable.

The base_url config for serial console is also added where the default
was previously used. The url is taken from the config option default in
the nova code: nova/conf/serial_console.py [1].

Closes-Bug: #1830417

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/8f00b5d/nova/conf/serial_console.py#L54

commit_message:
Configure console proxy ports in nova-cpu.conf

In change I8934d0b9392f2976347391c8a650ad260f337762, we began
configuring console proxy ports for multiple cells in the nova
controller config files to avoid "Address already in use" errors from
port collisions when running multiple cells on a single host.

This correspondingly configures the console proxy ports in the nova
compute config file based on what cell we're in, according to the
NOVA_CPU_CELL variable.

The base_url config for serial console is also added where the default
was previously used. The url is taken from the config option default in
the nova code: nova/conf/serial_console.py [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/8f00b5d/nova/conf/serial_console.py#L54

Change-Id: Id885fc5a769bce8111f1052a1b55d26be817c890
Closes-Bug: #1830417

commit_message:
Use puppet tasks to configure Apache MPM

Container puppet tasks does not fit for this purpose as
it is executed only once per a bootstrap node.

We want Apache configurations included for all controllers,
so use puppet_tasks for that with the added 'apache' tag.

We rely on the puppet base profiles of the services to include
the required apache configs.

Also, noop service resources for puppet step config via
the common puppet step config manifest.

Related-Bug: #1835414
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/674069

Change-Id: Ife25df81f19b31200c42e67723c82a9668d35cc3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop using veth pairs to connect qdhcp ns

veth pairs are currently being used to connect the qdhcp namespace
to the underlying bridge. This behaviour appears to only be needed
for old kernels with limited namespaces support (pre trusty).

Change-Id: I3b090f07c995cbf375dcc1dfdbadf0d7f10ec78e
Closes-Bug: #1832021

[{'created': '2019-07-04 13:31:36.000000000', 'message': "Ensure purging of the deleted httpd module configs

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf remains in the
containers running apache service, while puppet might want to remove
that file from the configuration, f.e. if switching MPM to 'event'.

Make kolla extended start enforcing the wanted state of such files.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2019-07-08 15:38:47.000000000', 'message': "Ensure purging of the deleted httpd module configs

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf remains in the
containers running apache service, while puppet might want to remove
that file from the configuration, f.e. if switching MPM to 'event'.

Make kolla extended start enforcing the wanted state of such files.

Additionally, puppet configuration steps for httpd require the
exec tag to be included in puppet_config. This is because
puppetlabs-apache ensures the modules config dir via an exec call
executed per each of its ::mod sub-classes.

Also add the missing kolla config for the placement API
/etc/httpd/conf.d path.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2019-07-09 08:32:53.000000000', 'message': "Ensure purging of the deleted httpd module configs

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf remains in the
containers running apache service, while puppet might want to remove
that file from the configuration, f.e. if switching MPM to 'event'.

As we cannot use kolla's extended start due to the conflicting src
paths, enforce the wanted state of such files via direct bind-mounting.
Also add the missing kolla config for the placement API
/etc/httpd/conf.d path.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-09 09:12:38.000000000', 'message': "Ensure purging/syncing the apache module configs

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
remains in the containers running apache service, while puppet might
want to remove that file from the configuration, or alter it in other
way, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event'.

Make kolla extended start enforcing the wanted state of such files.
When there is no kolla extended start used for the init-like
containers, use the direct bind-mount for the apache module configs.

Due to conflicting kolla config src paths, use another entry for the
module configs for extended start to pick it up from
/vsr/lib/kolla_config/etc. So that /var/lib/kolla_config/src/etc can be
used for the puppet-generated /etc/httpd/conf.d stuff w/o conflicts
with /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d.

Also add the missing kolla config for the placement API
/etc/httpd/conf.d path.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-09 14:12:14.000000000', 'message': "Ensure purging/syncing the apache module configs

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
remains in the containers running apache service, while puppet might
want to remove that file from the configuration, or alter it in other
way, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event'.

Make kolla extended start enforcing the wanted state of such files for
the related *_api service containers.

Due to conflicting kolla config src paths, use another entry for the
module configs for extended start to pick it up from
/vsr/lib/kolla_config/etc. So that /var/lib/kolla_config/src/etc can be
used for the puppet-generated /etc/httpd/conf.d stuff w/o conflicts
with /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d.

Also add the missing kolla config for the placement API
/etc/httpd/conf.d path.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-09 14:32:26.000000000', 'message': "Ensure purging/syncing the apache module configs

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
remains in the containers running apache service, while puppet might
want to remove that file from the configuration, or alter it in other
way, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event'.

Make kolla extended start enforcing the wanted state of such files for
the related *_api service containers.

Due to conflicting kolla config src paths, use another entry for the
module configs for extended start to pick it up from
/vsr/lib/kolla_config/etc. So that /var/lib/kolla_config/src/etc can be
used for the puppet-generated /etc/httpd/conf.d stuff w/o conflicts
with /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d.

Also add the missing kolla config for the placement API
/etc/httpd/conf.d path.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-09 15:08:46.000000000', 'message': "Ensure purging/syncing the apache module configs

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
remains in the containers running apache service, while puppet might
want to remove that file from the configuration, or alter it in other
way, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event'.

Make kolla extended start enforcing the wanted state of such files.
When there is no kolla extended start used for the init-like
containers, use the direct bind-mount for the apache module configs.

Due to conflicting kolla config src paths, use another entry for the
module configs for extended start to pick it up from
/vsr/lib/kolla_config/etc. So that /var/lib/kolla_config/src/etc can be
used for the puppet-generated /etc/httpd/conf.d stuff w/o conflicts
with /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d.

Explicitly inculde puppet apache base profile for puppet_config of
containers running API services in WSGI mode. This is needed to ensure
the HTTPD configuration early.

Also add the missing kolla config for the placement API
/etc/httpd/conf.d path.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-09 17:25:06.000000000', 'message': "Ensure purging/syncing the apache module configs

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
remains in the containers running apache service, while puppet might
want to remove that file from the configuration, or alter it in other
way, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event'.

Make kolla extended start enforcing the wanted state of such files.
When there is no kolla extended start used for the init-like
containers, use the direct bind-mount for the apache module configs.

Due to conflicting kolla config src paths, use another entry for the
module configs for extended start to pick it up from
/vsr/lib/kolla_config/etc. So that /var/lib/kolla_config/src/etc can be
used for the puppet-generated /etc/httpd/conf.d stuff w/o conflicts
with /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d.

Add 'apache' to the default puppet tags, so that container-puppet-tasks
ensure an appropriate apache configuration prior to the main deployment
steps.

Also add the missing kolla config for the placement API
/etc/httpd/conf.d path.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-11 10:08:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix generating Apache configs by container-puppet

The changes listed below provide a single unit of work required to
configure Apache backend for WSGI-based OpenStack API services
w/o conflicts causing containers startup failures.

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
or other conflicting httpd modules might remain in the containers
and cause startup failures. While puppet removes such conflicts from
the configuration, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event', and we
expect it never gets into container configs.

Add apache to the default puppet tags applied with the container-puppet
tool. This allows to configure httpd backend for WSGI applications
running in containers. Also skip service tags with container-puppet
(new feature as of Puppet 4.4).

Make kolla extended start properly enforcing the wanted state of the
removed by puppet files, like conflicting Apache MPM modules.
When there is no kolla extended start used for the init-like
containers, use the direct bind-mount for the apache module configs.

Additionally, ensure consistent mirroring across config-data
paths for the container-puppet tool:
  * Remove files missing in the source for the destination
    (puppet-generated) path. Acieved via using rsync --delete.
  * Purge obsoleted/irrelevant files in the destingation
    (puppet-generated) before rsyncing new contents into it

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-11 10:24:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix generating Apache configs by container-puppet

or other conflicting httpd modules might remain in the containers

the configuration, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event', and we

Add apache to the default puppet tags applied with the container-puppet

Make kolla extended start properly enforcing the wanted state of
/etc/httpd, including conf.d and conf.modules.d, and also any of the
removed by puppet files, like conflicting Apache MPM modules.

Additionally, ensure consistent mirroring across config-data

  * Purge obsoleted/irrelevant files in the destingation
    (puppet-generated) before rsyncing new contents into it

paths for the container-puppet tool. Purge obsoleted/irrelevant files
in the destingation (puppet-generated) before rsyncing new contents
into it.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-12 08:10:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix generating Apache configs by container-puppet

The changes listed below provide a single unit of work required to
configure Apache backend for WSGI-based OpenStack API services
w/o conflicts causing containers startup failures.

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
or other conflicting httpd modules might remain in the containers
and cause startup failures. While puppet removes such conflicts from
the configuration, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event', and we
expect it never gets into container configs.

Add apache to the default puppet tags applied with the container-puppet
tool. This allows to configure httpd backend for WSGI applications
running in containers. Also skip service tags with container-puppet
(new feature as of Puppet 4.4).

Make kolla extended start properly enforcing the wanted state of
/etc/httpd, including conf.d and conf.modules.d, and also any of the
removed by puppet files, like conflicting Apache MPM modules.
When there is no kolla extended start used for the init-like
containers, use the direct bind-mount for the apache module configs.

Due to conflicting kolla config src paths, use another entry for the
module configs for extended start to pick it up from
/vsr/lib/kolla_config/etc. So that /var/lib/kolla_config/src/etc can be
used for the puppet-generated /etc/httpd/conf.d stuff w/o conflicts
with /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d.

Additionally, ensure consistent mirroring across config-data
paths for the container-puppet tool. Purge obsoleted/irrelevant files
in the destingation (puppet-generated) before rsyncing new contents
into it.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix generating Apache configs by container-puppet

The changes listed below provide a single unit of work required to
configure Apache backend for WSGI-based OpenStack API services
w/o conflicts causing containers startup failures.

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
or other conflicting httpd modules might remain in the containers
and cause startup failures. While puppet removes such conflicts from
the configuration, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event', and we
expect it never gets into container configs.

Make kolla extended start properly enforcing the wanted state of
/etc/httpd, including conf.d and conf.modules.d, and also any of the
removed by puppet files, like conflicting Apache MPM modules.

Add container-puppet tasks to ensure apache MPM configs generated
before the main config steps that require Apache started in the
service container.

Additionally, ensure consistent mirroring across config-data
paths for the container-puppet tool. Purge obsoleted/irrelevant files
in the destingation (puppet-generated) before rsyncing new contents
into it.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: ceph-nfs: Add rpcbind to Ubuntu host bootstrap

It has to be on the host I presume? Would prefer not to have bootstrap-servers affected by enabled services.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-07-10 09:50:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> It has to be on the host I presume? Would prefer not to have
 > bootstrap-servers affected by enabled services.

It has to be on the host.
Me too - but the other options are:
1) Install it everytime on Ubuntu, even if deployment doesn't use ceph-nfs (I don't think I like that)
2) Add ceph-nfs Ubuntu to skipped images and add no support notice."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-10 13:54:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> > It has to be on the host I presume? Would prefer not to have
 > > bootstrap-servers affected by enabled services.
 > 
 > It has to be on the host.
 > Me too - but the other options are:
 > 1) Install it everytime on Ubuntu, even if deployment doesn't use
 > ceph-nfs (I don't think I like that)
 > 2) Add ceph-nfs Ubuntu to skipped images and add no support notice.

With all respect to your findings (which I rate highly) I seriously opt for option 2. It did not work, let's not try too hard to make it work. Having said that, I'm open to accepting this proposal if Mark decides so as well. I leave the decision to him."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-07-10 15:44:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-10 16:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
ceph-nfs: Add rpcbind to Ubuntu host bootstrap

* Ubuntu ships with nfs-ganesha 2.6.0, which requires to do an rpcbind
udp test on startup (was fixed later)
* Add rpcbind package to be installed by kolla-ansible bootstrap when
ceph_nfs is enabled
* Update Ceph deployment docs with a note

Change-Id: Ic19264191a0ed418fa959fdc122cef543446fbe5

commit_message:
Bump version of stackhpc.dell-powerconnect-switch

Version v1.1.0 includes useful updates needed for supporting the
PowerConnect 6248, such as support for 'enable' and quirky differences
in the CLI.

Change-Id: I1a9e0471f34183c85002de30c395b82baa5f3ef4

commit_message:
support alternate portage directories

The 17.1 profile changed the defaults used in portage for where we store
our repo, distfiles and binpkgs.  Some portage related variables need to
be set deterministically.  17.1 is no enabled for Systemd's profile.

Change-Id: Ib55f6875c5cb461c3c530b51d7420ce3dc8da360

commit_message:
ceph mds cap 'allow *' in extend_start

This applies the fix made in kolla-ansible (see [1])
to kolla ceph mon image directly.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/670035

Change-Id: I1822a8c610db72654bbacc7148e25a837090b680
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b1d4ed51f41721c86a33d766fdfd80aaccf1df60)

commit_message:
Update build profiles for Placement split

The Placement API is now a separate project, but anyone
building Nova is likely to want it. This change ensures
that it is built alongside Nova.

Change-Id: I05433f5bb2313e2adff39850a970d4430340c852

commit_message:
RAID create fails if 'controller' is missing in 'target_raid_config'

RAID creation fails with KeyError if none of the 'logical_disks'
in 'target_raid_config' have 'controller' parameter.

Story: 2006316
Task: 36043
Change-Id: I42ee6a46c002c14c785216834558223cbf9d319b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-25 07:29:34.000000000', 'message': 'placement_api: create valid apache config before installing package

If apache is (re)starting while the chef-client installs the
nova-placement-api package, it may pick up the vanilla apache2 conf file
before chef-client gets around to fixing it which may result in apache2
failing due to a non-working configuration.

This changeset eliminates the race by creating a valid configuration
before installing the software. The solution is based on the assumption
that no reasonably configured package manager will overwrite an
existing, user-created configuration file.

backport: queens

Change-Id: Id9f1d165411fc5b3cc73b29a36840cf4dc63d81b
'}]
commit_message:
placement_api: create valid apache config before installing package

If apache is (re)starting while the chef-client installs the
nova-placement-api package, it may pick up the vanilla apache2 conf file
before chef-client gets around to fixing it which may result in apache2
failing due to a non-working configuration.

This changeset eliminates the race by creating a valid configuration
before installing the software. The solution is based on the assumption
that no reasonably configured package manager will overwrite an
existing, user-created configuration file.

backport: queens

Change-Id: Id9f1d165411fc5b3cc73b29a36840cf4dc63d81b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-25 23:24:44.000000000', 'message': "Hide availability zones that are not available

Availability zones that were unavailable should have been filtered
from the list, but weren't due to incomplete filtering.

This commit specifically tests whether the AZ status is available
before allowing it in the list of choices.

This filtering mechanism is the same as how the OpenStack dashboard
'Launch Instance' dialog handles availability zone availability.

Change-Id: I8bdb38e29209aff92f51532812b409e48462a0af
"}]
commit_message:
Hide availability zones that are not available

Availability zones that were unavailable should have been filtered
from the list, but weren't due to incomplete filtering.

This commit specifically tests whether the AZ status is available
before allowing it in the list of choices.

This filtering mechanism is the same as how the OpenStack dashboard
'Launch Instance' dialog handles availability zone availability.

Change-Id: I8bdb38e29209aff92f51532812b409e48462a0af

commit_message:
Transport ManilaCephFSDataPoolName to Manila CephFS template

This is necessary to configure the Manila CephFS backend
correctly when user customizes the CephFS pool name.

Change-Id: Ie7ac4567b5d6d10df558b15927bfc2f9ba6cdfe0
Depends-On: I3adaa442b8c53ff902761d1dba283a79494c8ae6
Closes-Bug: 1837099
(cherry picked from commit dbac7cf92c8739ae5bf1de9f9238e7a6d354e65f)

commit_message:
Allow for customization of the Manila CephFS pool name

Manila needs to know the CephFS pool name, which the deployer
might want to customize when the Ceph cluster is externally managed.

Change-Id: I3adaa442b8c53ff902761d1dba283a79494c8ae6
Partial-Bug: 1837099
(cherry picked from commit e3b39a8d67466ff6ccebaf95fa1ed527582e6389)
(cherry picked from commit 3c4748b46238002acda87a65c4150f0ce3d579cb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 17:05:28.000000000', 'message': "Wire-in Apache MPM module parameters

Allow to configure Apache MPM module for the containerized API/WSGI'ish
services running Apache as a backend. The default is 'prefork' and
provides no upgrade nor update impact.

We hope that switching the default from 'prefork' to 'event' might
alleviate the related heartbeats threading issue.

Merge the missing TLSProxyBase config settings for Octavia API and Horizon.
Merge the missing ApacheServiceBase config settting for Ironix PXE.
This is needed to apply the base Apache service hiera
settings, including MPM module switches, for those as well.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/671321
Related-bug: #1829062

Change-Id: Ia65af7a9d6ae106a61ec52912bebba72830d5f28
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Wire-in Apache MPM module parameters and switch it

Allow to configure Apache MPM module for the containerized API/WSGI'ish
services running Apache as a backend. Change the default from 'prefork'
to 'event', which is a low level change and should provide no sensible
upgrade impact. This alleviates the related heartbeats threading issue
arising with the monkey-patched eventlet.

Merge the missing ApacheServiceBase config settings for Octavia API,
Horizon and Ironix PXE. This is needed to apply the base Apache
service hiera settings, including MPM module switches, for those
as well.

Related-bug: #1829062

Change-Id: Ia65af7a9d6ae106a61ec52912bebba72830d5f28
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for monitor_{address,port} in UDP members

UDP members didn't support monitor_address and monitor_port parameters.
Setting those values didn't have any effects.

This commit enables the support of both parameters.

Story: 2005775
Task: 33492

Change-Id: Idaacfa60a1909d3f5e0f94371a405c8ce8ae9efa

subject: Fix generating Apache configs by container-puppet
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 12:45:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix generating Apache configs by container-puppet

The changes listed below provide a single unit of work required to
configure Apache backend for WSGI-based OpenStack API services
w/o conflicts causing containers startup failures.

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
or other conflicting httpd modules might remain in the containers
and cause startup failures. While puppet removes such conflicts from
the configuration, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event', and we
expect it never gets into container configs.

Make kolla extended start properly enforcing the wanted state of
/etc/httpd, including conf.d and conf.modules.d, and also any of the
removed by puppet files, like conflicting Apache MPM modules.

Due to conflicting kolla config src paths, use another entry for the
module configs for extended start to pick it up from
/vsr/lib/kolla_config/etc. So that /var/lib/kolla_config/src/etc can be
used for the puppet-generated /etc/httpd/conf.d stuff w/o conflicts
with /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d.

Add container-puppet tasks to ensure apache MPM configs generated
before the main config steps that require Apache started in the
service container.

Additionally, ensure consistent mirroring across config-data
paths for the container-puppet tool. Purge obsoleted/irrelevant files
in the destingation (puppet-generated) before rsyncing new contents
into it.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1472877af9ced4726be5ecdf7ae3cabf99669f42)
"}, {'created': '2019-08-01 09:22:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix generating Apache configs by container-puppet

The changes listed below provide a single unit of work required to
configure Apache backend for WSGI-based OpenStack API services
w/o conflicts causing containers startup failures.

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
or other conflicting httpd modules might remain in the containers
and cause startup failures. While puppet removes such conflicts from
the configuration, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event', and we
expect it never gets into container configs.

Make kolla extended start properly enforcing the wanted state of
/etc/httpd, including conf.d and conf.modules.d, and also any of the
removed by puppet files, like conflicting Apache MPM modules.

Add container-puppet tasks to ensure apache MPM configs generated
before the main config steps that require Apache started in the
service container.

Additionally, ensure consistent mirroring across config-data
paths for the container-puppet tool. Purge obsoleted/irrelevant files
in the destingation (puppet-generated) before rsyncing new contents
into it.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1472877af9ced4726be5ecdf7ae3cabf99669f42)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix generating Apache configs by container-puppet

The changes listed below provide a single unit of work required to
configure Apache backend for WSGI-based OpenStack API services
w/o conflicts causing containers startup failures.

W/o this change /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/00-mpm.conf shipped with RPM
or other conflicting httpd modules might remain in the containers
and cause startup failures. While puppet removes such conflicts from
the configuration, f.e. when switching MPM 'prefork' to 'event', and we
expect it never gets into container configs.

Make kolla extended start properly enforcing the wanted state of
/etc/httpd, including conf.d and conf.modules.d, and also any of the
removed by puppet files, like conflicting Apache MPM modules.

Add container-puppet tasks to ensure apache MPM configs generated
before the main config steps that require Apache started in the
service container.

Additionally, ensure consistent mirroring across config-data
paths for the container-puppet tool. Purge obsoleted/irrelevant files
in the destingation (puppet-generated) before rsyncing new contents
into it.

Closes-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: I3e5b4372a01b29bf13179d8a16acc36da9c5caab
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1472877af9ced4726be5ecdf7ae3cabf99669f42)

subject: Wire-in Apache MPM module parameters and switch it
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-01 09:30:34.000000000', 'message': "Wire-in Apache MPM module parameters and switch it

Allow to configure Apache MPM module for the containerized API/WSGI'ish
services running Apache as a backend. Change the default from 'prefork'
to 'event', which is a low level change and should provide no sensible
upgrade impact. This alleviates the related heartbeats threading issue
arising with the monkey-patched eventlet.

Merge the missing ApacheServiceBase config settings for Octavia API,
Horizon and Ironix PXE. This is needed to apply the base Apache
service hiera settings, including MPM module switches, for those
as well.

Related-bug: #1829062
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/673974

Change-Id: Ia65af7a9d6ae106a61ec52912bebba72830d5f28
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 09cfcc1464dce0eb7c05caf42375290bbaae4199)
"}]
commit_message:
Wire-in Apache MPM module parameters and switch it

Allow to configure Apache MPM module for the containerized API/WSGI'ish
services running Apache as a backend. Change the default from 'prefork'
to 'event', which is a low level change and should provide no sensible
upgrade impact. This alleviates the related heartbeats threading issue
arising with the monkey-patched eventlet.

Merge the missing ApacheServiceBase config settings for Octavia API,
Horizon and Ironix PXE. This is needed to apply the base Apache
service hiera settings, including MPM module switches, for those
as well.

Related-bug: #1829062
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/673974

Change-Id: Ia65af7a9d6ae106a61ec52912bebba72830d5f28
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 09cfcc1464dce0eb7c05caf42375290bbaae4199)

subject: During deploy, always sync DB
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-12 13:23:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-12 13:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nThis one had merge conflicts.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-08-02 08:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-02 09:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 13:23:02.000000000', 'message': "During deploy, always sync DB

A common class of problems goes like this:

* kolla-ansible deploy
* Hit a problem, often in ansible/roles/*/tasks/bootstrap.yml
* Re-run kolla-ansible deploy
* Service fails to start

This happens because the DB is created during the first run, but for some
reason we fail before performing the DB sync. This means that on the second run
we don't include ansible/roles/*/tasks/bootstrap_service.yml because the DB
already exists, and therefore still don't perform the DB sync. However this
time, the command may complete without apparent error.

We should be less careful about when we perform the DB sync, and do it whenever
it is necessary. There is an argument for not doing the sync during a
'reconfigure' command, although we will not change that here.

This change only always performs the DB sync during 'deploy' and
'reconfigure' commands.

Change-Id: I82d30f3fcf325a3fdff3c59f19a1f88055b566cc
Closes-Bug: #1823766
Closes-Bug: #1797814
(cherry picked from commit d5e5e885d11e338806425839a361d868c1f4ff10)
"}]
commit_message:
During deploy, always sync DB

A common class of problems goes like this:

* kolla-ansible deploy
* Hit a problem, often in ansible/roles/*/tasks/bootstrap.yml
* Re-run kolla-ansible deploy
* Service fails to start

This happens because the DB is created during the first run, but for some
reason we fail before performing the DB sync. This means that on the second run
we don't include ansible/roles/*/tasks/bootstrap_service.yml because the DB
already exists, and therefore still don't perform the DB sync. However this
time, the command may complete without apparent error.

We should be less careful about when we perform the DB sync, and do it whenever
it is necessary. There is an argument for not doing the sync during a
'reconfigure' command, although we will not change that here.

This change only always performs the DB sync during 'deploy' and
'reconfigure' commands.

Change-Id: I82d30f3fcf325a3fdff3c59f19a1f88055b566cc
Closes-Bug: #1823766
Closes-Bug: #1797814
(cherry picked from commit d5e5e885d11e338806425839a361d868c1f4ff10)

messages:
[{'account_id': 30013, 'date': '2019-07-17 09:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:38:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

from a glance looks perfect, just 2 things inline'}, {'account_id': 30013, 'date': '2019-07-24 16:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30013, 'date': '2019-07-24 16:52:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-07-25 10:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-07-25 10:51:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Looks good to me.

This patch reminds me that may be our data model is unexplainable rigid and thus it keeps getting complicated.

It's suspicious that we have to define pairs of types e.g. Mapped (one type) List (second, nested type). It would be way more powerful and flexible to have our data model allowing for constructing complex types out of distinct primitives e.g. Mapped(List) or Mapped(Mapped) or Mapped(List(Mapped(int))).

Just an observation."}, {'account_id': 30013, 'date': '2019-07-26 07:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-07-26 08:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-08-02 08:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-08-02 08:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add MappedListField

The MappedList field supports a list of mapped instances. This type of
field is being used by the `SupportedControllerProtocols` and the
`SupportedDeviceProtocols` fields of a Storage Controller in the
Storage resource.

Change-Id: Ifd83b72a283e44d890c98ae646ef831467ed4af8

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: I70fe9d99f585c3df8692975f8cc993d3db951b24

commit_message:
Role Extra Config Post hook points to the wrong Heat resource.

Having {{role.name}}ExtraConfigPost will
make to execute resources like,
type: OS::TripleO::NodeExtraConfigPost

In this case we need to execute each extra config
step depending on the role name.

Change-Id: I32d6fb755723beb7b78623e50bd58dddb3e8e794

commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility of rbd get_fsid

In py3 librados's get_fsid() function returns a binary string
which breaks comparison when compared with the same value as a
string. This is currently breakin the logic that compares ceph
cluster fsids when deciding whether the image used to boot an
instance is cow-clonable.

Change-Id: I79b40ca40400c67b0805926096317afd875ffabb
Closes-Bug: #1816468
(cherry picked from commit e8b6b0bc78ec229803d1d27f8a4706e2c425bd77)
(cherry picked from commit b4b47a59c7ff1d60e69dbdea07de9163948cb680)

commit_message:
Fix typo in active/standby scenario error handling

The following IndexError exception is thrown when amphora ssh key file
is missing:

File [..]/octavia_tempest_plugin/tests/act_stdby_scenario/v2/\
test_active_standby_iptables.py, line 237, in _get_amphora_ssh_key
        .format(key_file))
    IndexError: tuple index out of range

Change-Id: I446de2920d3f01b2dc224e8ffab46274cddfefa1

commit_message:
Noop service resources for puppet step config

Similarly to container-puppet tooling, we need to
noop the service puppet resources globally.

This enables configuring Apache MPM for t-h-t.

Related-Bug: #1835414

Change-Id: Ib33b3591a553910f03fb5c5e81847059b0e94b9c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-05-13 02:52:35.000000000', 'message': 'Record libvirt log using rsyslog running on host

Currently libvirt records log to stdout, and journald traps these logs
and resends them to host syslog.
This causes duplicated timestamp recorded for each log line, because
libvirt sends log with timestamp, and also rsyslog assignes timestamp
when it recieves log records.

This patch makes libvirt send log directly to rsyslog running on host,
to remove the duplicated timestamp assignment.

Change-Id: I6e5ac7f5971df5998db22c5d392084fddf77d34a
'}, {'created': '2019-05-29 23:00:25.000000000', 'message': 'Record libvirt log using rsyslog running on host

and resends them to host syslog.
This causes duplicated timestamp recorded for each log line, because
libvirt sends log with timestamp, and also rsyslog assignes timestamp
when it recieves log records.

This patch makes libvirt send log directly to rsyslog running on host,
to remove the duplicated timestamp assignment.

Change-Id: I6e5ac7f5971df5998db22c5d392084fddf77d34a
'}]
commit_message:
Record libvirt log using rsyslog running on host

Currently libvirt records log to stdout, and journald traps these logs
and resends them to host syslog.
This causes duplicated timestamp recorded for each log line, because
libvirt sends log with timestamp, and also rsyslog assignes timestamp
when it recieves log records.

This patch makes libvirt send log directly to rsyslog running on host,
to remove the duplicated timestamp assignment.

Change-Id: I6e5ac7f5971df5998db22c5d392084fddf77d34a

commit_message:
Add nova cell initialization to unit file

Without this patch, the nova-conductor service will fail due to not
having an initialized cell0. This initialization needs to happen after
the api_db setup, but before the main db sync, according to the install
docs[1]. This patch adds the necessary step to the nova-api service unit
file and corrects the sequence order.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/install/controller-install-obs.html#install-and-configure-components

Change-Id: Ic08c2aedd4c9ffb980e61af0dd9d320a89bafa24

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-27 06:07:51.000000000', 'message': "Delete/overwrite symlinks better

Previously, when deleting a symlink that points to an xLO, we'd clean
up the xLO's segments then delete the symlink, leaving the xLO itself
busted.

Similar trouble would come from overwriting a symlink pointing to an
xLO. Check for a Content-Location in the HEAD response and leave such
segments.

Change-Id: I45b210cf380a68bd88187c91fa2d63a8b2bb709b
"}, {'created': '2019-08-01 20:49:10.000000000', 'message': "Delete/overwrite symlinks better

Previously, when deleting a symlink that points to an xLO, we'd clean
up the xLO's segments then delete the symlink, leaving the xLO itself
busted.

Similar trouble would come from overwriting a symlink pointing to an
xLO. Check for a Content-Location in the HEAD response and leave such
segments.

Change-Id: I45b210cf380a68bd88187c91fa2d63a8b2bb709b
"}, {'created': '2019-08-02 03:44:01.000000000', 'message': "Delete/overwrite symlinks better

Previously, when deleting a symlink that points to an xLO, we'd clean
up the xLO's segments then delete the symlink, leaving the xLO itself
busted.

Similar trouble would come from overwriting a symlink pointing to an
xLO. Check for a Content-Location in the HEAD response and leave such

commit_message:
Delete/overwrite symlinks better

Previously, when deleting a symlink that points to an xLO, we'd clean
up the xLO's segments then delete the symlink, leaving the xLO itself
busted.

Similar trouble would come from overwriting a symlink pointing to an
xLO. Check for a Content-Location in the HEAD response and leave such
segments.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I45b210cf380a68bd88187c91fa2d63a8b2bb709b

commit_message:
Add to_build as an acceptable feastureset_override

This is required to determine when to  build images.
The variable is used in oooq ansible but is passed
per job.

subject: Remove ProviderIds namedtuple
messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-31 11:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-31 14:39:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Hmph.

I don't like the thought of explicitly exposing a sqla object up the stack like this. It feels like it breaks a principle of abstraction. But it clearly works, and if it's more performant..."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-31 14:45:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't like the thought of explicitly exposing a sqla object up
 > the stack like this.

That's _exactly_ what sqla is for. It provides abstractions around the sql queries. So what we were doing here was needlessly wrapping an abstraction around an abstraction that was already doing the job we wanted.

On top of that: within the 'objects' package we are (at least for now) fully committed to sqla, so...

If we didn't have that commitment we'd probably have a lot more to debate here, but ..."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-01 15:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-01 15:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-01 15:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, simple nit tweaks in PS2 and efried was +2 on PS1 so fast approving.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-01 21:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-01 21:48:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I just fixed pep8'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-31 11:41:17.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ProviderIds namedtuple

It turns out that all the callers of methods that return ProviderIds
access the data using attributes that are already present on the object
provided by the sql alchemy RowProxy object. Creating a namedtuple is
redundant and adds some processing cost [1].

However, the AnchorIds namedtuple used in the same file _is_ necessary
because it provides a hashable type required by the set that wraps
the collection of AnchorIds.

The other user of namedtuple, RPCandidate, in
placement/objects/rp_candidates.py has a specific interface for which
a namedtuple is correct.

[1] provider_ids_from_rp_ids was identified as being a major contributor
when doing performance profiling. Most of the cost is executing with the
database, but the tuple creation is a factor.

Change-Id: I1e1522eae7b4360cf57c34164612ae228fad14a3
'}, {'created': '2019-08-01 15:26:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ProviderIds namedtuple

commit_message:
Remove ProviderIds namedtuple

It turns out that all the callers of methods that return ProviderIds
access the data using attributes that are already present on the object
provided by a sql alchemy RowProxy object (which is the result of
iterating a ResultProxy object, returned by sqla.execute()). Creating
a namedtuple is redundant and adds some processing cost [1].

However, the AnchorIds namedtuple used in the same file _is_ necessary
because it provides a hashable type required by the set that wraps
the collection of AnchorIds.

The other user of namedtuple, RPCandidate, in
placement/objects/rp_candidates.py has a specific interface for which
a namedtuple is correct.

[1] provider_ids_from_rp_ids was identified as being a major contributor
when doing performance profiling. Most of the cost is executing with the
database, but the tuple creation is a factor.

Change-Id: I1e1522eae7b4360cf57c34164612ae228fad14a3

commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Add cron job to verify snapshot repositories

This adds a cron job to manually verify all snapshot repositories
are registered to any active master and data nodes. This is to
address scenarios where master and data nodes do not have the
desired snapshot repositories registered following node outages
or reboots

Change-Id: Ie6f42e95c3ca4dc2ec70f2852a2bde11e59ec097
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Introduce bashate

This commit introduces bashate[0] which is a code style checker for bash
scripts. We already have some bash scripts in Tempest repo. So, it might
be good to check the style automatically.

Some scripts under the tools directory are also fixed due to the bashate
violation.

Change-Id: I07820f10387552f93a9d8891b58a8c7fcdb83046
